notes: ﻿Attakapas Parish no longer exists; however, the area that Attakapas covered includes what would go on later to be Abbeville. In Abbeville, there is a church named Mary Mag, which I believe this 1836 church to be a precursor for.

﻿according to histories of two churches and the location of German Coast, it was probably this one; 13396 River Rd, Destrehan, LA 70047  https://scphistory.org/gmedia/18_p23_germancoastmap-jpg/
https://www.stcharlesthibodaux.org/history
﻿This source would imply that there was a St. Francis Church here at one point; however, it seems like it was either abandoned or destroyed or changed names

Unnamed: 31: ﻿I believe this is the same church, or grew out of the same congregation. Per the church's site, Catholic congregated and held service on their own before a priest was sent in. The fact the almanac says vacant speaks to this historic fact. As such, I am saying this is the same institution, or a precursor to it, and keeping the ID for that reason: https://www.stmarybasilica.org/history/

instName: ﻿Convent and Academy of the Ladies of the Sacred Heart
affiliated: ﻿[under the direction of the Ladies of the Sacred Heart]
notes: ﻿"Acadia Parish" wasn't an actual Parish (county) in 1835.  Instead, it seems to be gesturing towards a place Acadians settled (the Acadian Coast) http://louisianeacadien.com/acadiachurches.html
Unnamed: 31: ﻿The branches taught in this institution are as follow: Elements of Botany, Chemistry, Natural, Philosophy and Geometry, Reading, Writing and Grammar, both English and French, Arithmetic, History, Ancient and Modern, Chronology, Mythology, English and French Polite Literature, Geography, Elements of Astronomy, the use of the Globes, Domestic Economy, plain and fancy Needle Work, Embroidery, Marking, Lace work, &c. Music, Drawing, and other fine arts, are paid extra.

﻿The system of instruction embraces the following objects: the English and French languages, Writing, Arithmetic, Geography, the Use of the Globes, History, Ancient and Modern, Mythology, Chronology, English and French Literature, Elements of Astronomy, Plain and Fancy Needle Work. The Elements of Natural Philosophy, of Botany and Chemistry, will be taught to those young Ladies, whose parents desire it, as also Music, Drawing and Dancing.

affiliated: ﻿conducted by the Ladies of the Sacred Heart
﻿under the care of Sisters of Charity
﻿under the care of Sisters of Charity
